DOC.brief_summary: The specific aim of this study is to examine the efficacy and safety of lisdexamfetamine compared with placebo in outpatients with binge eating disorder
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study of Lisdexamfetamine to Treat Binge Eating Disorder
DOC.criteria: Patients will meet DSMIV criteria for BED for at least the last 6 months Women who are pregnant or lactating and women of childbearing potential who are not taking adequate contraceptive measures. If there is a possibility a female subject might be pregnant, a pregnancy test will be performed. (All women of childbearing potential will have a negative pregnancy test before entering the study.) Subjects who are displaying clinically significant suicidality or homicidality. A current or recent (within 6 months of the start of study medication) DSMIV diagnosis of substance abuse or dependence
